ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English todai, from Old English tō dæge, meaning 'on this day', combining tō ('to, on') and dæge (dative form of dæg 'day').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: adverb (modifies a verb, adjective, or other adverb)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: On this current day; during the daytime of this calendar date.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 在今天；在本日；在眼前这一天。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: I can't meet you today because I have too much work.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我今天不能见你，因为我有太多工作。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun (a word used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The present time or era; the current moment in history or life.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 当今；现代；目前的时代或时期。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The challenges of today are different from those of the last century.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 当今的挑战与上个世纪的不同。
